intro: Pluchea appendiculata, commonly known as the Mexican ragweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as riverbanks and wetlands. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
